item.title: 美国 12 月住宅建筑商信心指数升至八个月高点
item.description: 美国住宅建筑商的信心在 12 月份升至八个月来的最高点，但建筑活动仍受到进口关税导致的建筑成本上升的制约。【原文：U.S. homebuilder sentiment edged up to an eight-month high in December, but activity remained constrained by rising construction costs because of tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 墨西哥对部分美国猪肉进口展开贸易调查
item.description: 墨西哥政府周一表示，在国内生产商指控美国进口的猪腿肉和猪肩肉定价不公并获得政府支持后，墨西哥已对美国进口的猪腿肉和猪肩肉展开反倾销和反补贴调查。【原文：Mexico has opened an anti-dumping and anti-subsidy probe into U.S. pork leg and shoulder imports after domestic producers alleged unfair pricing and government support, the government said on Monday.】

item.title: 美联储主席米兰：当前通胀不能反映经济供求关系
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬-米兰（Stephen Miran）周一表示，目前高于目标的通胀率并不反映潜在的供需动态，这些动态导致价格上涨更接近央行 2% 的目标，他断言 "价格现在再次趋于稳定"。【原文：Current above-target inflation does not reflect underlying supply and demand dynamics that are generating price increases much closer to the central bank's 2% target, Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said on Monday, asserting that "prices are now once again stable."】

item.title: Downdetector 显示 Spotify 有数千用户宕机
item.description: 据 Downdetector.com 网站报道，音乐流媒体平台 Spotify 周一有数千名用户宕机。【原文：Music streaming platform Spotify was down for thousands of users on Monday, according to Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 美国发起招聘人工智能工程师担任联邦职务的运动
item.description: 据路透社周一浏览的一个政府网站称，特朗普政府已启动一项活动，计划聘用 1000 名工程师在联邦政府任职，任期两年。【原文：The Trump administration has launched a campaign to hire 1,000 engineers into federal government roles for two-year stints, according to a government website viewed by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯法院在力拓诉俄铝（Rio Tinto）的 13.2 亿美元诉讼案中裁定俄铝胜诉
item.description: 根据法庭文件，俄罗斯法院在铝业巨头 Rusal 对全球矿业和金属公司力拓（Rio Tinto）提起的价值 1,047.5 亿卢布（13.2 亿美元）的诉讼中做出了有利于 Rusal 的裁决。【原文：A Russian court has ruled in favour of Rusal in the aluminium giant's 104.75-billion-rouble ($1.32 billion) lawsuit against global mining and metals company Rio Tinto , , according to court documents.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司认为工人罢工不会影响生产
item.description: 巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）在一份声明中说，自周一部分工人开始有计划的罢工以来，石油和石油产品的产量没有受到任何影响。【原文：Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras has seen no impact on its output of oil and petroleum products since the start of a planned strike by some workers on Monday, it said in a statement.】

item.title: 消息人士称，空中客车公司 12 月上半月交付了约 30 架喷气式飞机
item.description: 业内消息人士和分析师周一表示，空中客车公司在12月上半月交付了约30架飞机，由于一些航空公司正在等待近期机身问题的修复细节，该公司本月的飞机交付速度低于平均水平。【原文：Airbus has delivered around 30 aircraft in the first half of December, releasing jets at a below-average speed for the month as some airlines wait for details of fixes to a recent fuselage problem, industry sources and analysts said on Monday.】

item.title: 行业组织称，美国对外国游客的社交媒体要求可能对旅游产生 "寒蝉效应
item.description: 代表美国旅行和旅游业的一个组织周一警告说，要求数百万外国游客提供过去五年中使用过的社交媒体账号的提议可能会对赴美旅游产生 "寒蝉效应"。【原文：A group representing the U.S. travel and tourism industry warned Monday that a proposal to require millions of foreign visitors to provide social media handles used over the past five years could have a "chilling effect" on visits to the United States.】

item.title: 在中国人工智能产品蓬勃发展之际，英伟达发布新的开源人工智能模型
item.description: 随着中国人工智能实验室开源产品的大量涌现，英伟达（Nvidia）周一发布了一系列新的开源人工智能模型，并称这些模型将比之前的产品更快、更便宜、更智能。【原文：Nvidia on Monday unveiled a new family of open-source artificial intelligence models that it says will be faster, cheaper and smarter than its previous offerings, as open-source offerings from Chinese AI labs proliferate.】

item.title: 花旗投资主管转投贝莱德，负责管理 800 亿美元的合作项目
item.description: 贝莱德（BlackRock）周一表示，花旗银行投资管理部门的负责人已加入该资产管理公司，领导其扩大合作关系，贝莱德将为该银行的财富管理客户监管约 800 亿美元的资产。【原文：BlackRock said on Monday that the head of Citi's investment management arm has joined the asset manager to lead an expanded partnership under which BlackRock will oversee about $80 billion in assets for the bank's wealth‑management clients.】

item.title: 智利投资者欢呼卡斯特当选总统
item.description: 在右翼强硬派何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（Jose Antonio Kast）以绝对优势战胜左翼候选人珍妮特-哈拉（Jeannette Jara）当选总统后，智利比索兑美元汇率周一走强。【原文：The Chilean peso strengthened against the U.S. dollar on Monday after right-wing hardliner Jose Antonio Kast was elected president in a commanding runoff win against leftist candidate Jeannette Jara.】

item.title: 充足的石油供应使中国暂时免受委内瑞拉石油供应中断的影响
item.description: 交易商和分析师表示，在美国上周扣押一艘委内瑞拉油轮之前，已经有大量委内瑞拉石油运往中国，加上原油储存过剩和需求疲软，将限制此举对中国市场的短期影响。【原文：The volume of Venezuelan oil already headed to China before the U.S. seized a Venezuelan tanker last week, plus a glut of crude in storage and weak demand, will limit the near-term impact of the move in the Chinese market, traders and analysts said.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉 PDVSA 称运营未受网络攻击影响，并指责美国
item.description: 委内瑞拉国家石油公司（PDVSA）周一在一份声明中说，该公司和委内瑞拉石油部遭到了由美国和国内同谋策划的网络攻击。【原文：Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA was subject to a cyber attack orchestraed by the U.S. and domestic conspirators, the company and the country's oil ministry said in a statement on Monday, adding operations have been unaffected, though four sources said systems remained down, affecting oil cargo deliveries.】

item.title: Netflix 表示对与华纳兄弟发现公司交易的立场不变
item.description: Netflix 联合首席执行官格雷格-彼得斯（Greg Peters）和泰德-萨兰多斯（Ted Sarandos）周一在致员工的一封信中表示，Netflix 收购华纳兄弟发现公司资产的决定没有改变，派拉蒙天舞公司的恶意竞购 "完全在意料之中"。【原文：Netflix's decision to acquire assets from Warner Bros Discovery has not changed and the hostile bid from Paramount Skydance was "entirely expected", its co-CEOs Greg Peters and Ted Sarandos said in a letter to employees on Monday.】

item.title: 菲利普斯 66 预测 2026 年支出将增加
item.description: 菲利普斯 66 周一预测 2026 年的支出将增加，因为这家美国炼油商预计中游和炼油部门的支出将增加。【原文：Phillips 66 forecast higher spending in 2026 on Monday as the U.S. refiner expects increased disbursement in its midstream and refining segments.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，法国和意大利一致认为有必要推迟南方共同市场的最终投票
item.description: 两名熟悉讨论情况的消息人士周一告诉路透社，意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼和法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙已就推迟欧盟对南方共同市场贸易协定的最终投票的必要性达成一致。【原文：Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and French President Emmanuel Macron have agreed on the need to delay a final European Union vote on the Mercosur trade deal, two sources familiar with the discussion told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: Viola Ventures 为两只新基金筹集 2.5 亿美元，投资以色列初创企业
item.description: 以色列风险投资公司 Viola Ventures 周一表示，它已为两个新基金筹集了 2.5 亿美元资金，以支持 "下一代以色列初创企业"。【原文：Israeli venture capital firm Viola Ventures said on Monday it had raised $250 million in capital for two new funds to back the "next generation of Israeli startups".】

item.title: 花旗将 2026 年标准普尔 500 指数目标定为 7700 点，预计人工智能仍将是主旋律
item.description: 花旗集团将 2026 年 S&P 500 指数的年终目标定为 7700 点，并指出企业盈利强劲以及人工智能投资带来的持续顺风。【原文：Citigroup has set a year-end target of 7,700 for the S&P 500 index for 2026, pointing to robust corporate earnings and sustained tailwinds from artificial intelligence investments.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局调查吉普车后螺旋弹簧故障维修召回事件
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周一开始调查因后螺旋弹簧安装不当而召回 331,401 辆吉普汽车的事件。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Monday opened a probe into the recall of 331,401 Jeep vehicles due to improperly installed rear coil springs.】

item.title: 普华永道称，以色列科技行业年度交易和上市跃升至 590 亿美元
item.description: 普华永道以色列公司（PwC Israel）周一表示，随着 Alphabet 以 320 亿美元收购以色列网络安全公司 Wiz，收购和首次公开募股激增，今年对以色列技术创新的热情依然不减。【原文：Appetite for Israeli technology innovation has remained undiminished this year, with a surge in acquisitions and IPOs led by Alphabet's $32 billion purchase of Israeli cybersecurity company Wiz, PwC Israel said on Monday.】

item.title: 对冲基金流向 高盛表示，上周对冲基金抛弃了日本和香港的科技股
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）在一份报告中称，对冲基金上周抛售了香港和日本的股票，而在此之前，科技股比重较大的恒生指数和日经指数因担心科技价值过度膨胀而在过去两个交易日下跌。【原文：Hedge funds sold Hong Kong and Japanese stocks last week, Goldman Sachs said in a note, just before the tech-heavy Hang Seng and Nikkei indices fell in the last two trading sessions on worries over over-inflated tech values.】

item.title: 早间竞价人工智能大跌后股市迎来喘息机会
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 星展银行被指定为新加坡第二家人民币清算行
item.description: 星展银行被指定为新加坡第二家人民币清算行，这是周一在中国西南部重庆举行的年度双边会议上签署的 27 项协议之一。【原文：DBS Bank was appointed as the second renminbi (RMB) clearing bank in Singapore, one of 27 agreements signed during an annual bilateral meeting held in southwest China's Chongqing on Monday.】

item.title: 数据密集的一周伊始，华尔街期货走高
item.description: 美国股指期货周一走高，在上周末科技股主导的大跌笼罩华尔街之后企稳，投资者为本周可能决定利率前景的关键经济数据做好准备。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Monday, steadying after a tech-led selloff gripped Wall Street late last week and as investors geared up for a week packed with key economic data that could determine the outlook for interest rates.】

item.title: 铜价因空头回补而上涨，暂时忽略疲软的中国数据
item.description: 铜价周一上涨，原因是一些交易商在本周合约到期前提前结清了头寸，帮助市场暂时抛开疲软的数据和对第一大消费国中国房地产行业的担忧。【原文：Copper prices rose on Monday as some traders rolled forward positions ahead of a contract expiry this week, helping the market to set aside weak data and worries about the property sector in top consumer China for now.】

item.title: 橡树树支持的公司推出价值 12 亿美元的阿姆斯特丹数据中心项目
item.description: 橡树资本（Oaktree Capital）支持的公司 Pure Data Centres 周一表示，计划斥资 10 亿欧元（11.7 亿美元）在阿姆斯特丹建设一个园区，这是今年欧洲宣布的最大 "超大规模 "数据中心投资项目之一。【原文：Oaktree Capital-backed firm Pure Data Centres said on Monday it plans to spend up to 1 billion euros ($1.17 billion) on an Amsterdam campus, in one of the biggest 'hyperscale' data centre investments announced in Europe this year.】

item.title: 巴菲特的继任者格雷格-阿贝尔在伯克希尔公司稳步发展
item.description: 格雷格-阿贝尔接替沃伦-巴菲特执掌伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway），将为这位加拿大人的崛起画上句号。【原文：The elevation of Greg Abel to replace Warren Buffett at the helm of Berkshire Hathaway will cap the rise of a native Canadian who won over the legendary investor for being committed to the company's culture, long-term thinking, and an ability to spend money wisely.】

item.title: 文件显示，美国要求欧盟将其天然气豁免于甲烷排放法之外
item.description: 路透社看到的一份美国政府文件显示，美国要求欧盟在 2035 年前免除其石油和天然气在欧盟甲烷排放法下的燃料进口义务。【原文：The United States has demanded that the European Union exempt its oil and gas from obligations under the bloc's methane emissions law on fuel imports until 2035, a U.S. government document seen by Reuters showed.】

item.title: 独家报道特斯拉董事会通过股票奖励获利 30 亿美元，令科技同行相形见绌
item.description: 根据薪酬与治理专家 Equilar 为路透社进行的一项分析，特斯拉董事会通过股票奖励获得了超过 30 亿美元的收入，远远超过美国最大科技公司的同行在获得奖励时的价值。【原文：Tesla's board of directors has earned more than $3 billion through stock awards that far exceeded the value of those given to peers at the biggest U.S. technology firms at the time they were paid, according to an analysis performed for Reuters by compensation and governance specialist Equilar.】
